bug.author: lorenzomammana
bug.summary: Wrong import of the random module
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Training the model with the latest commit is not working, this is caused by an error when importing the random module. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Input: <denchmark-code>from random import random
# Multi-scale if opt.multi_scale: sz = random.randrange(imgsz * 0.5, imgsz * 1.5 + gs) // gs * gs # size sf = sz / max(imgs.shape[2:]) # scale factor if sf != 1: ns = [math.ceil(x * sf / gs) * gs for x in imgs.shape[2:]] # new shape (stretched to gs-multiple) imgs = F.interpolate(imgs, size=ns, mode='bilinear', align_corners=False) </denchmark-code>
Output: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 477, in <module> train(hyp, opt, device, tb_writer) File "train.py", line 288, in train sz = random.randrange(imgsz * 0.5, imgsz * 1.5 + gs) // gs * gs # size AttributeError: 'builtin_function_or_method' object has no attribute 'randrange' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
It should train normally, if <denchmark-code>from random import random </denchmark-code>
is changed to <denchmark-code>import random </denchmark-code>
everything works fine Or since you've moved to all explicit imports it's probably correct to import choices and randrange only from random. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS: Ubuntu GPU Tesla V100 Python 3.8.2

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lorenzomammana>@lorenzomammana</denchmark-link> thank you buddy! Can you submit a PR with your proposed fix please? We just had a PR that modified some imports, it may have broken this functionality.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Pluto1314>@Pluto1314</denchmark-link> this should be resolved now in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/commit/eb99dff9ef4f6f2c26e6cda2f6fe1abfabce8929>eb99dff</denchmark-link> . Please git pull and try again.
Will close, please advise if problem persists.
